div.p: Guidance on interpreting the table can be found here.

span.title:
Sponsor's study ID
Use the new extension to connect Observation to ResearchStudy.

Sponsor's study ID
Use the new extension to connect Observation to ResearchStudy.

tr.td:
Mapping is based on presumption that research subject will be tied to site-specific ResearchStudy, which will then be part of overall ResearchStudy.
The path using the extension will only exist if the system maintaining the Observation is aware of its relevance to the Study.

span.title:
Sponsor's site ID
Use the new extension to connect Observation to ResearchStudy.

Sponsor's site ID
Use the new extension to connect Observation to ResearchStudy.

tr.td:
Mapping is based on presumption that research subject will be tied to site-specific ResearchStudy, which will then be part of overall ResearchStudy.
The path using the extension will only exist if the system maintaining the Observation is aware of its relevance to the Study.

span.title: Sponsor's investigator ID
Sponsor's investigator ID

tr.td:
Will need to decide which id to expose. If you want the PI for the overall study rather than just for the site associated with the Observation, you'll need to traverse the partOf.resolve() from the study-specific ResearchStudy.
The path using the extension will only exist if the system maintaining the Observation is aware of its relevance to the Study.

span.title: Sponsor to use SUBJID to determine/derive USUBJID
Sponsor to use SUBJID to determine/derive USUBJID

tr.td:
Study subject is found by finding the StudySubject that corresponds to the same Patient and ResearchStudy as the Observation.
No standard way to decide which subject identifier to use

span.title: Observation/encounter data need to be dictated by the protocol and contain the Sponsor defined values in Research resources.
Observation/encounter data need to be dictated by the protocol and contain the Sponsor defined values in Research resources.
Observation/encounter data need to be dictated by the protocol and contain the Sponsor defined values in Research resources.
Observation/encounter data need to be dictated by the protocol and contain the Sponsor defined values in Research resources.

tr.td:
We could go through Encounter.basedOn-> ServiceRequest.instantiatesCanonical, you arrive at ActivityDefinition.
Encounter should have a standard instantiatesCanonical extension that would allow pointing to the ActivityDefinition. This would be the ActivityDefinition.name. Submit a change request to add the extension

span.title: As reported from the Site
As reported from the Site

tr.th: Specimen Actual Collection Start Date and Time

span.title: To map directly, the data must be formatted in ISO 8601 date/time format (e.g., 2015-02-07T13:28:17-05:00)

td.span:
LBDTC
(NOTE: no mapping included for CDASH LBDAT and LBTIM)

tr.th: Specimen Actual Collection End Date and Time

span.title: To map directly, the data must be formatted in ISO 8601 date/time format (e.g., 2015-02-07T13:28:17-05:00)

td.span:
LBENDTC
NOTE: No mapping included for CDASH LBENDAT and LBENTIM)

tr.th: Specimen Collection Duration (for Clinical Research with extended time of collection)

span.title: Contains both the duration and unit.
Must be ISO 8601 PT12H for duration of 12 hours. Typically for urine samples. Conversion of LBCDUR that contains both duration and units.

tr.th: Specimen Planned Time Point Name (Planned Collection Time Point - time within Encounter)

span.title: If the words do not match what the Sponsor desires, put the text in this variable.
Wording needs to match what is required by Sponsor

tr.td: TBD - change being made to Specimen resource

tr.th: Specimen Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Reference

span.title: e.g., 3 hours post dose; sponsor would have to translate data to ISO-8601 to use LBCELTM data in LBELTM
See instructions in column C. This needs to be converted from LBCELTM.

tr.td: TBD - change being made to Specimen resource

span.title:
Proposed CDASH variable (Specimen Condition as Collected)
Terminology in current Code System Content does not match CDISC terminology. Both systems have terms that are not in the other. An "as collected" version of the SDTM variable is recommended to allow the sponsor to make adjustments to ensure terminology compliance while mapping to SDTM.
To use this, sponsor must first ensure compliant terminology (compliant either to CDISC or sponsor extensions) will be used.

tr.td:
TBD - change being made to Specimen resource
Extend the FHIR vocabulary to include CDISC values. NOTE: requires an extension to the FHIR vocabulary to include CDISC values (e.g., Refrigerated)

span.title: Specimen as collected. Current FHIR terminology does not align to CDISC terminology. (At least not the example) An "as collected" version of the SDTM variable is recommended to allow the sponsor to make adjustments to ensure terminology compliance while mapping to SDTM.
To use this, sponsor must first ensure compliant CDISC terminology (compliant either to CDISC or sponsor extensions) will be used.

tr.td: NOTE: In some cases, this may be inferred from the LOINC.

span.title: HL7 terminology is binding. Does not match CDISC CT with is just No/Yes/Unknown/Not Applicable

Converted from LBCFAST and/or HL7 FHIR to match the CDISC controlled terminology requirements.
FHIR -> CDISC F => Y NF => N NG => U
Must provide a way to explain what this is answering. May need to answer this for a particular test.

td.span: LBCOND (confirmation that protocol defined condition was met - e.g. fasting)

tr.td: This is an 'ask on entry' question. May be able to determine some conditions, such as fasting, by using other specimen.collection attributes (e.g., fasting status). Others might be captured as components or extensions. Alternatively, obtain this information from the case report form entries.
There are explicit elements for Specimen.collection.fastingStatus and collection.fastingDuration. May need extensions for other pre-conditions

span.title: As reported from the lab
Must be aligned with controlled terminology.
As reported from the lab.

Need to translate to blank or N if not received as blank or N
May not be applicable for safety labs.
Take from the panel name on the EHR. The battery could be used by the sponsor to populate this and then translate into sponsor-specific terminology.

Terminology is defined by sponsor (no CDISC controlled terminology exists) Need to derive this to organize results for the statistical and reporting teams. Sponsor may want a different category than was reported by the lab.

tr.td: NOTE: In some cases, this may be inferred from the LOINC.

span.title: Could be used to accept true for this resource and later populate LBSTAT as NOT DONE

Needs to be translated from FHIR vocabulary to SDTM controlled terminology:
FHIR -> CDISC: Not performed = NOT DONE Cancelled = NOT DONE Completed = <blank>

tr.td: Observation.basedOn (Ref: ServiceRequest for doNotPerform and status)

Sponsor may choose to map a situation in which the entire panel is cancelled as one summary record compliant with SDTM IG examples. Some sponsor may decline to accept cancelled records under specific circumstances (e.g., unscheduled) Sponsor may also choose to populate LBREASND as CANCELLED

span.title: See notes on LBSTAT
Translate to compliant terminology (if needed)
Translate to compliant terminology (if needed)
Use LOINC terminology
Use LOINC terminology
The name of the lab that performed the analysis.
The name of the lab that performed the analysis.
As reported by the lab.
Must match CDISC controlled terminology
Use a controlled vocabulary list for the toxicity grade. There is not a CDISC standard for this.
The version number as reported by the lab.
See Toxicity Grade Code List - LBTOX - 1
The coding system as reported by the lab.
Needs to be translated from the URI and version to a name concatenated with the version.
As reported from the lab.
As reported from the lab
As reported from the lab.
As reported from the lab
Character indicator of a normal value, the way the lab sends it.
Sponsor would normalize this.
As reported from the lab
As reported from the lab
As reported from the lab
As reported from the lab
The value as reported by the lab
Needs to be translated to match the controlled terminology, if not already compliant
Designation from the investigator. May be notation on the individual result.
Must be mapped to supplemental qualifier.
Method as collected (as reported by the laboratory).
Must be aligned with controlled terminology.
Must be aligned with controlled terminology.

tr.th: Run ID (ties data together across subjects)

span.title: May not be applicable for safety labs.
May not be applicable for safety labs.

tr.td: Would need to introduce an extension

span.title: This would not be sent by the lab - we would expect to get study-specific subject ID
Probably will not be provided by lab.
Probably will not be provided by lab.

tr.td: This wouldn't come from the lab.

span.title: Not for basic safety labs
Not for basic safety labs
N/A - this is not for human clinical trials
N/A - this is not for human clinical trials

tr.td: This can sort of be inferred from the absence of a link to a PlanDefinition or ActivityDefinition, however there are lots of other reasons these links could be missing, so that's not totally reliable. Could look at using an extension or a tag

tr.th: Planned Time Point Number (sequence to order the relative timepoints)

span.title: Pull this information from the Clinical Plan (PlanDefinition)

tr.td: Pull this information from the Clinical Plan (PlanDefinition)
Link to the clinical plan would be through the Observation.basedOn link to CarePlan or the instantiatesCanonical link to PlanDefinition or ActivityDefinition

span.title: Does not apply to safety labs

tr.td: This does not apply to safety labs.
The corresponding values need to be evaluated and aligned accordingly to the CDISC context of --METHOD. Potentially could appear in Observation.method. An extension is required to distinguish.

span.title: This may be deprecated. May appear on CRF, but would not be in EHR.

tr.td: Variable may be deprecated. This information would come from the Sponsor.

Could appear in Observation.reasonCode. In practice the notion of 'baseline' is more of a relationship. Any arbitrary Observation might be selected as the 'baseline' for a particular step in the study. As such, the real linkage is the tie to the CarePlan activity that's tied to the ActivityDefinition with a reason of 'baseline'.

span.title: This will not be received from the EHR - this would be created by the Sponsor when Sponsor derives data from values received from lab. (sponsor doing the derivation)

tr.td: This information would come from the Sponsor.

FHIR doesn't use a flag. If an Observation is derived, it should point to the Observations it's derived from with the derivedFrom association. (If that relationship is present, then the Derived Flag is true)
